description: Least number of distinct prime factors in odd numbers having an abundancy index > n.
comments: The abundancy index of a number k is sigma(k)/k. - _T. D. Noe_, May 08 2006
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: R. K. Guy, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, 1988-04-12 (annotated scanned copy)
Richard Laatsch, Measuring the abundancy of integers, Mathematics Magazine 59 (2) (1986) 84-92.
mathematica: prod=1; k=1; Table[While[prod<=n, k++; prod=prod*Prime[k]/(Prime[k]-1)]; k, {n,2,12}] (* _T. D. Noe_, May 08 2006 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A005579 (least number of distinct prime factors in even numbers having an abundancy index > n).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
